moves.1. e4:
i do enjoy annotating the games that i won, there are many games that i lost, but i don't like to remember them, i think this is a human behaver and i think majority of people do the same, so expect to see me smiling with joy at the end of this game.
disregard what i said and let us start :
please note that i will use these abbreviations :
N = knight
B = bishop
o-o or o-o-o = castling
K = king
Q = queen
P = pawn
R = rock 
i like this starting move because it control the center and open the way to Q and B
moves.3. Bc4: developing with attack to P in f7, good move
moves.3... Nf6: developing with attack to P in e4
moves.4. d3: advancing and opening a way to B
moves.4... Be7 5. a3: some players don't like it, they think it is wast of time, but i do it to prevent B or N from going to b4 square
moves.6. h3: to prevent N from coming closer to my K
moves.6... d6: it opened a way to one B and close it to the other ? !
moves.7. c3: it opened a long way to my Q
moves.8. Bxe6: the only benefit is to break his pawn chain
moves.10. Qb3: to reinforce the attack on the weak square e6
moves.11. O-O: o-o there was no better move in this time than this one
moves.11... Rad8: to be ready to control the d file after exchange pawns in the center
moves.12. Re1: to enforce P in the center
moves.12... h6: to get red of N from this advancing position
moves.13... d4: to open the way to his heavy weapons (Q, R, N)
moves.14... Nh5: opening the way to B and ready to jump to advanced square f4
moves.15. Nc4: to attack P in e5 and then Q
moves.15... Bf6 16. Rd1 Nf4: to be in an advancing position
moves.17. Kh2: to be away from attack of N if it jump to e2
moves.17... Qf7: to the way to get check mate with help of N
moves.18. g3: to prevent this coming danger before it happened
moves.18... Nxh3: after some calculations he sacrificed the N to get good tempo  ??
moves.19. Kxh3: after some calculations i found it is safe to get the gift
moves.20. Kg2: K run back protecting it self and N
moves.20... Be7: to give the way to R ?? i think Q in g4 better
moves.21. Ncd2: N protecting N and attacking P in e6 by Q  with check !! good move
moves.21... Rf6: protection to P in e6 and to give the way to duple the rocks in the f file !! good move
moves.22... Qg4: Q in g4, but too late
moves.24. Qd1: Q left attacking in e6 because now it is well protected with Q and R, and went back for support and help !! good move
moves.24... Rdf8: more power to f file !! good move
moves.25. c4 Nd8: back to support Q and rocks
moves.26. Qe2:
position is critical, his full power will be towards my K, the big battle will be in f3 or in f2, so
the Q should be closer to the mentioned squares
moves.26... Nf7: to be in the battle field
moves.27. Rh1 Ng5: attacking my N, i think big battle will start soon
moves.28... Qxg5: forced, he don't want to lose more material, he is already ( - 2 )
moves.29. Rf1: now the real big battle in f2, so my R came to help
moves.29... Qg6 30. b3: to give pass to my B
moves.30... Rf6f7: to give pass to B to be in the battle field
moves.31. Rh1: to stop B from coming to h4 ! ?
moves.31... Rf7xf2+: got my P in f2 with check
moves.33... h5: advancing may be will help Q to attack my K
moves.34. Nf3: N will stop this P advance
moves.34... Qg4: Q is advancing this time to its coming trap ?????? big mistake
moves.35. Nxe5:
Nxe5 !!!!!!! excellent move
Q is completely trapped, no where to go unless exchange her self with a single pawn.
  at this position he resigned.
conclusion : 
1- my opponent is a good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes.
2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will  appreciate what i 
    have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing.
3- your advice, comments and evaluation will be appreciated with my thanks. 
4- i like you all.
5- thank you.
6- a lot of thanks to GameKnot.
friend of all   mustafa
